result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles F. Hoffman Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waushara County Clerk of Courts Office

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain and maintain full time employment, unless medically excused by a treating physician.

Defendant to maintain timely, uninterrupted payments as ordered in Waushara Co Case No. 2001PA36.  Orders subject to modification in the future by further order of the Court. All payments are to be paid through the Wisconsin Support Collections Trust Fund (WISCTF), not through the Department of Corrections.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent. Defendant is to maintain a valid address with Child Support and the Court.

timeConds.notes: With Huber, No Good Time Credit

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is entitled to Huber Privileges and Good Time Credit. The Court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction. The Court orders 271 days credit for time served applicable to Count 1.
Concurrent with: Waushara County Case Nos. 10CF128 & 12CF25.
The Court orders the unpaid costs be converted to a civil judgment.

Revoked Sentenced to County Jail

10CF128, 12CF25, 14CF16 Cases called @ 01:14 PM Defendant Charles F. Hoffman in court with attorney Evan J Dahl.  Defendant Charles F. Hoffman in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The parties have received the revocation packet. No corrections or clarifications to be noted by DA Anderson. Atty Dahl makes one note of clarification. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. The parties stipulate to 10CF128 & 12CF95 - 90 days CFTS,  14CF16: Ct 1 - 271 days CFTS, Ct 2 - 134 days CFTS.  Sentencing argument by DA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Atty Dahl. Statement by DE. 10CF128: 1 year WC Jail consecutive to any other sentence currently being served  - Huber, GT, 90 days CFTS, The Court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction.12CF25:  1 year WC Jail concurrent with 10CF128 - Huber, GT, 90 days CFTS, The Court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction. 14CF16: Cts 1 & 2  1 year WC Jail concurrent with each other, 10CF128 & 12CF25  - Huber, GT,Ct 1 - 271 CFTS, Ct 2 - 134 days CFTS, The Court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction. The Court orders all unfulfilled costs be converted to a civil judgment.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 11:39 am cases called. 10CF128, 12CF25 & 14CF16. Defendant Charles F. Hoffman in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on record. Preliminary hearings addressed-Defendant wishes to waive the right to a preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver of right to preliminary hearing. Court has read the complaints and finds probable cause a felony has been committed within the courts jurisdiction and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Informations filed. Attorney Szilagyi confirms receipt and waives further reading.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to 10CF128 (Ct 1.), No Contest to 12CF25 (Ct. 1) & No Contest to 14CF16 (Cts. 1 & 2). Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 2-6 in 10CF128, Counts 2 & 3 in 12CF25, Counts 3 & 4 in 14CF16. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant on all cases to: SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 4 years. CONDITIONS: CT-1-14cf 16 only. 6 months WCJ, with Huber, No Good Time Credit. Credit for 44 days served. CONDITIONS on ALL COUNTS: Make timely payments of child support within 01PA36, Full time employment, Valid mailing and physical addresses with COC & Child Support, Terms of Agent, Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 23, 2014 at 11:30 am.
State's
Status conference on October 30, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 10CF128, 12CF25 & 14CF16 Cases called @ 1:28 p.m. Defendant Charles F. Hoffman in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Charles F. Hoffman in custody.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 12CF25 & 14CF16 - Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived. The court entertains waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing in both 12CF25 & 14CF16.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State. Motion by Atty Szilagyi to amend the bond to a lower cash bond or a signature bond. The court declines to modify the bond in any way.  Status conference scheduled for October 30, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant's
Initial appearance on September 25, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
BOND APPLICABLE TO CASE NOS. 10CF128, 12CF25 & 14CF16. Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin.
